discussion.content: Is this dump still valid for the corrent exam?

D. Title 18, Section 2703(f) of the United States Code authorizes an investigator to request that an ISP preserve email records. This statute obligates the ISP to preserve records and other evidence in its possession for a period of 90 days, which can be extended for an additional 90-day period upon request.

questions.question_text: When an investigator contacts by telephone the domain administrator or controller listed by a Who is lookup to request all e-mails sent and received for a user account be preserved, what U.S.C. statute authorizes this phone call and obligates the ISP to preserve e-mail records?

choices.B: create a sparse data copy of a folder or file
choices.A: create a compressed copy of the file with DoubleSpace

questions.question_text:
You are contracted to work as a computer forensics investigator for a regional bank that has four 30 TB storage area networks that store customer data.
What method would be most efficient for you to acquire digital evidence from this network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Bit-stream disk-to-image copies all the data, including the partitions

questions.question_text: You are employed directly by an attorney to help investigate an alleged sexual harassment case at a large pharmaceutical manufacture. While at the corporate office of the company, the CEO demands to know the status of the investigation. What prevents you from discussing the case with the CEO?

discussion.content: Work product refers to the writings, notes, memoranda, reports on conversations with the client or witness, research and confidential materials that reflect an attorney's impressions, conclusions, opinions, or legal research or theories.Work product materials are confidential and are not required to be submitted in answer to discovery requests or subpoenae.

questions.question_text:
What is the investigator trying to analyze if the system gives the following image as output?
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It lists the currently active logon sessions and, if you specify the -p option, the processes running in each session.

choices.D: Details of users who can logon

choices.B: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The National Software Reference Library (NSRL), is a project of the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) which maintains a repository of known software, file profiles and file signatures for use by law enforcement and other organizations involved with computer forensic investigations.

questions.question_text: This organization maintains a database of hash signatures for known software.
